headline: Solo safari works well with the right structure
summary: Solo travelers can have excellent safari experiences, particularly on group departures or at camps with communal dining. The main considerations are cost (single supplements add 30-50%) and social preference. Solo travelers often find safari uniquely rewarding as guides provide personalized attention and fellow travelers share the experience at meals.

assumptions.text: Most lodges charge 30-50% single supplements for solo occupancy.
Group departures eliminate single supplements and provide built-in social interaction.
Most safari camps have communal dining, creating natural social opportunities.

gains: Complete flexibility in itinerary and pace
Natural social opportunities at communal meals
losses: Single supplements add 30-50% to accommodation costs
No travel companion for downtime between drives

change_conditions: If budget is constrained, group departures eliminate single supplements entirely.
If preferring solitude, private camps with in-room dining can accommodate.
If safety is a concern, established safari circuits are very safe for solo travelers.
